docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's populist budget proposal, announced on Tuesday, is a pointed attempt to bolster ties with congressional Democrats ahead of high-stakes elections in November.

headline.main: Obama Budget: a Boon Midterm Narrative for Democrats?
headline.print_headline: Obama Budget: a Boon Midterm Narrative for Democrats?

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama's populist budget proposal, announced on Tuesday, is a pointed attempt to bolster ties with congressional Democrats ahead of high-stakes elections in November.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration will allow consumers to extend health insurance plans that fail to comply with President Barack Obama's healthcare law beyond 2014, according to three people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: White House Readies Health Insurance Renewal Extension: Sources
headline.print_headline: White House Readies Health Insurance Renewal Extension: Sources

docs.snippet: The Obama administration will allow consumers to extend health insurance plans that fail to comply with President Barack Obama's healthcare law beyond 2014, according to three people familiar with the matter.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Arkansas House of Representatives voted on Tuesday to fund the state's so-called "Private Option" medical insurance program that has drawn interest from lawmakers in other states as an alternative to Obamacare.

headline.main: Arkansas Lawmakers Vote to Fund State's Alternative to Obamacare
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Lawmakers Vote to Fund State's Alternative to Obamacare

docs.snippet: The Arkansas House of Representatives voted on Tuesday to fund the state's so-called "Private Option" medical insurance program that has drawn interest from lawmakers in other states as an alternative to Obamacare.

docs.lead_paragraph: Arkansas' first-in-the-nation plan that uses Medicaid funds to buy private insurance for the poor survived an effort to defund it Tuesday, as lawmakers gave final approval to continue a program that has extended health coverage to nearly 94,000 people.

headline.main: Arkansas Compromise Medicaid Expansion Stays Alive
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Compromise Medicaid Expansion Stays Alive

docs.snippet: Arkansas' first-in-the-nation plan that uses Medicaid funds to buy private insurance for the poor survived an effort to defund it Tuesday, as lawmakers gave final approval to continue a program that has extended health coverage to nearly 94,000...

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's budget pushes Health and Human Services spending over $1 trillion for the first time, reflecting an aging population adding to the Medicare rolls, as well as expanded coverage for younger people through the new health law.

headline.main: Health Care Agency Passes $1 Trillion Milestone
headline.print_headline: Health Care Agency Passes $1 Trillion Milestone

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama's budget pushes Health and Human Services spending over $1 trillion for the first time, reflecting an aging population adding to the Medicare rolls, as well as expanded coverage for younger people through the new health law.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama released his fiscal year 2015 budget request to Congress on Tuesday, and lawmakers will promptly ignore it.

headline.main: Factbox: Details of U.S. President Obama's Fiscal Year 2015 Budget
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Details of U.S. President Obama's Fiscal Year 2015 Budget

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama released his fiscal year 2015 budget request to Congress on Tuesday, and lawmakers will promptly ignore it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Texans went to the polls on Tuesday in primary elections where the top candidates for governor were projected to post easy wins and favorites of the conservative Tea Party movement shook up several races with established Republicans.

headline.main: Big Names Set to Win in Texas Primaries Shaken by Tea Party Influence
headline.print_headline: Big Names Set to Win in Texas Primaries Shaken by Tea Party Influence

docs.snippet: Texans went to the polls on Tuesday in primary elections where the top candidates for governor were projected to post easy wins and favorites of the conservative Tea Party movement shook up several races with established Republicans.

docs.lead_paragraph: In his 2015 budget, President Obama will propose removing illegal immigrants from the Medicare rolls and require citizenship or lawful presence in the country as a condition of getting benefits.

headline.main: Crackdown Proposed to Prevent Illegal Immigrants From Obtaining Medicare
headline.print_headline: Crackdown by Medicare Seeks to Verify Residency

docs.abstract: Pres Obama's 2015 budget will include proposal to remove illegal immigrants from Medicare rolls and require citizenship or lawful presence in country as condition of getting benefits.
docs.snippet: In his 2015 budget, President Obama will propose removing illegal immigrants from the Medicare rolls and require citizenship or lawful presence in the country as a condition of getting benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: Americans for Prosperity is unveiling a new ad after being challenged by a Michigan Democratic lawmaker who demanded verification of the claims of a woman in the initial commercial who said she had lost her preferred health plan.

headline.main: Conservative Group Counters Criticism of Ad Against Health Law
headline.print_headline: Group Counters Criticism of Ad Against Health Law

docs.abstract: Americans for Prosperity, conservative advocacy group being challenged by Democrats over the content of its ads attacking the health care law, is pushing back with a new commercial featuring the same woman who says she lost her preferred health plan.
docs.snippet: Americans for Prosperity is unveiling a new ad after being challenged by a Michigan Democratic lawmaker who demanded verification of the claims of a woman in the initial commercial who said she had lost her preferred health plan.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A report from the chairman of the House Budget Committee finds flaws with almost every attempt the government has made to relieve poverty and its effects since the 1960s.

headline.main: Mr. Ryan’s Small Ideas on Poverty
headline.print_headline: Mr. Ryan’s Small Ideas on Poverty

docs.abstract: Editorial maintains report from Rep Paul Ryan indicting 50 years of government antipoverty efforts is poorly reasoned and factually distorted; holds Republican Party has no interest in repairing flaws in programs like Medicaid and food stamps, but simply wants intellectual cover as it seeks to eliminate as many as possible.
docs.snippet: A report from the chairman of the House Budget Committee finds flaws with almost every attempt the government has made to relieve poverty and its effects since the 1960s.
